text: Exopalystes is a monotypic genus of Papuan huntsman spiders containing the single species, Exopalystes pulchellus. It was first described by Henry Roughton Hogg in 1914, and is found in Papua New Guinea. ==See also== * List of Sparassidae species ==References== Category:Monotypic Araneomorphae genera Category:Sparassidae Category:Spiders of Oceania
title: Exopalystes
